intro: Tribulopsis, commonly known as the golden cup, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers that often have a yellow or orange hue. The plant typically grows in moist environments such as wet meadows and streambanks. Tribulopsis species are often found in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
